subject: Ethics
title: Jus Ad Bellum Criteria
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Jus Ad Bellum Criteria.

hook.text: Before a nation fires a single shot, six moral tests must be passed. Most wars fail at least one.

buildup.text: Jus ad bellumâ€”'right to war'â€”demands just cause, legitimate authority, right intention, and last resort.

discovery.text: It also requires a reasonable chance of success and proportionality between the cost and the goal.

twist.text: The Iraq War passed some tests but failed others. Defenders and critics used the same framework.

climax.text: Jus ad bellum doesn't prevent warsâ€”it forces leaders to justify them publicly against clear criteria.

punchline.text: Six tests. Most wars can't pass them all honestly.

quiz.question: Which is NOT a requirement of jus ad bellum?
options: Guaranteed victory before any fighting begins
